law.catch_line: Transfer of Delegated Authority from the County Manager to the County Mayor.

text.section:
Sec. 1-4.4. Transfer of Delegated Authority from the County Manager to the County Mayor.
Commencing with the elimination of the County Manager as a Miami-Dade County Home Rule Charter County officer on November 20, 2012, all delegations of Board authority, power and responsibility to the County Manager provided in enactments of this Board including, but not limited to, ordinances, resolutions, implementing orders, regulations, rules, and provisions of the Code of Miami-Dade County are hereby delegated to the County Mayor or the County Mayor's designee. All references in enactments of this Board including, but not limited to, ordinances, resolutions, implementing orders, regulations, rules, and provisions of the Code of Miami-Dade County relating to the County Manager shall be deemed to be references to the County Mayor or the County Mayor's designee.
